title: Google\Cloud\Speech\SpeechClient
name: SpeechClient
description: Google Cloud Speech enables easy integration of Google speech recognition technologies into developer applications. Send audio and receive a text transcription from the Cloud Speech API service. Find more information at the Google Cloud Speech docs.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration Options.

params.name: config.projectId
params.description: The project ID from the Google Developer's Console.

params.name: config.authCache
params.description: A cache for storing access tokens. Defaults to a simple in memory implementation.

params.name: config.authCacheOptions
params.description: Cache configuration options.

params.name: config.authHttpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests specifically for authentication.

params.name: config.httpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests. Only valid for requests sent over REST.

params.name: config.keyFile
params.description: The contents of the service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developer's Console. Ex: json_decode(file_get_contents($path), true).

params.name: config.keyFilePath
params.description: The full path to your service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developers Console.

params.name: config.retries
params.description: Number of retries for a failed request. Defaults to 3.

params.name: config.scopes
params.description: Scopes to be used for the request.

params.name: config.languageCode
params.description: The language of the content to be recognized. Only BCP-47 (e.g., "en-US", "es-ES") language codes are accepted. See Language Support for a list of the currently supported language codes. This value will be used by default for any requests sent through the client. If not provided, you must include a language code with each individual request.

methods.name: recognize
methods.description: Runs a recognize request and returns the results immediately. Ideal when working with audio up to approximately one minute in length.

examples.caption: Run with speech contexts, sample rate, and encoding provided

params.name: audio
params.description: The audio to recognize. May be a resource, string of bytes, a URI pointing to a Google Cloud Storage object in the format of gs://{bucket-name}/{object-name} or a Google\Cloud\Storage\StorageObject.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.detectGcsUri
params.description: When providing $audio as a string, this flag determines whether or not to attempt to detect if the string represents a Google Cloud Storage URI in the format of gs://{bucket-name}/{object-name}. Defaults to true.

params.name: options.languageCode
params.description: The language of the content. BCP-47 (e.g., "en-US", "es-ES") language codes are accepted. See Language Support for a list of the currently supported language codes. This value will be required if a default has not been set on the client. Defaults to the value set on the client.

params.name: options.sampleRateHertz
params.description: Sample rate in Hertz of the provided audio. Valid values are: 8000-48000. 16000 is optimal. For best results, set the sampling rate of the audio source to 16000 Hz. If that's not possible, use the native sample rate of the audio source (instead of re-sampling). For .flac and .wav files the Speech API will make a best effort to read the sample rate from the file's headers.

params.name: options.encoding
params.description: Encoding of the provided audio. May be one of "LINEAR16", "FLAC", "MULAW", "AMR", "AMR_WB". For .flac and .wav files the Speech API will make a best effort to determine the encoding type from the file's headers.

params.name: options.maxAlternatives
params.description: Maximum number of alternatives to be returned. Valid values are 1-30. Defaults to 1.

params.name: options.profanityFilter
params.description: If set to true, the server will attempt to filter out profanities, replacing all but the initial character in each filtered word with asterisks, e.g. \"f*\". Defaults to** false.

params.name: options.speechContexts
params.description: A list of arrays where each element must contain a key phrases. Each key phrases should contain an array of strings which provide "hints" to the speech recognizer to favor specific words and phrases in the results. Please see SpeechContext for more information.

methods.name: beginRecognizeOperation
methods.description:
Runs a recognize request as an operation. Ideal when working with audio longer than approximately one minute. Requires polling of the returned operation in order to fetch results.

For longer audio, up to approximately 80 minutes, you must use Google Cloud Storage objects as input. In addition to this restriction, only LINEAR16 audio encoding can be used for long audio inputs.

methods.name: operation
methods.description: Lazily instantiates an operation. There are no network requests made at this point. To see the operations that can be performed on an operation please see Google\Cloud\Speech\Operation.

examples.caption: Access an existing operation by its server generated name.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the operation to request.
